page.title: 14LOXTON
page.content: LOXTON VILLAGE IS SITUATED ON THE WESTERN SIDE OF THE LOX YEO VALLEY AT THE JUNCTION OF THE VALLEY ROAD AND THE BANWELL ROAD. IT IS A PICTURESQUE VILLAGE, DIFFERINGFROM MOST MENDIP VILLAGES IN THE ARCHITECTURAL STYLE OF ITS LARGEST HOUSE,THE MANOR.IT RESEMBLES A MEDITERRANEAN BUILDING,RATHER THAN AN ENGLISH BUILDING,AND WITH THE CHURCH,IT DOMINATES THE VILLAGE. THE MANOR DOMINATED THE LOXTON AREA FOR MANY CENTURIES.THE CHURCH WAS BUILT IN THE THIRTEENTH CENTURY AND ITS LIVING WAS IN THE GIFT OF THE MANOR. ONLY THREE OF THE ORIGINAL FORMS REMAIN BUT THERE IS A GARAGE,BLACKSMITH,CARPENTER AND VILLAGE SHOP. IT IS VERY MUCH SELF CONTAINED.
